name: sprite.getDirection()
content:
The sprite's movement direction in degrees.

The direction angle is a number from -180 to 180, 0 is to the right, clockwise increasing.

The velocity of the sprite, its speed and direction, can be set in many ways:

- by using the "counter pattern" on [`sprite.x`(#f78183)](/docs/gamelab/x/) and [`sprite.y`(#f78183)](/docs/gamelab/y/) properties within the [`draw()`(#fff176)](/docs/gamelab/draw/) function
- by setting the  [`sprite.velocityX`(#f78183)](/docs/gamelab/velocityX/) and  [`sprite.velocityY`(#f78183)](/docs/gamelab/velocityY/) properties
- by calling [`sprite.setVelocity()`(#f78183)](/docs/gamelab/setVelocity/) or [`sprite.setSpeedAndDirection()`(#f78183)](/docs/gamelab/setSpeedAndDirection/)

examples.name: Circling
examples.description: Move a sprite in a circle.

return_value: The direction angle of the sprite in degrees.
